title: Ju Seung-jin
text:
Joo Seung-Jin (born March 12, 1975) is a South Korean former professional <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player who mainly played as a defender. He played mainly as a side attacker on the right side but has also played in many different positions such as either defending or attacking middle fielder. Joo SeungJin made more than 160 Football League appearances in South Korea, most prominently for <a href="Daejeon%20Citizen">Daejeon Citizen</a> and <a href="Busan%20I%27Park">Busan I'Park</a> (formerly <a href="Daejeon%20Citizen">Daejeon Citizen</a>).
In terms of his coaching history, he began to coach at U-15 <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a> as an assistant coach. After two years, he took the position as a head coach at U-15 <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a> for three years and another three years as a head coach at U-18 <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a>. During the time when he was a head coach of U-18, he was appointed as a director of whole youth academy at <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a>. Now, he is the current assist coach of <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a> first team.
Into coaching.
As shown above, he took his first steps into coaching with professional football youth team called "<a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a>" U-15 as a coach from 2010–2011. After two years with his enthusiasm into coaching, he progressed as the Head coach of U-15, leading them into the <a href="K-League">K-League</a> Junior Champions for three years from 2012–2015. With these excellent results <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a> promoted him into the Head coach of U-18 in 2016. No doubt that he also made amazing results, lifting U-18 three <a href="K-League">K-League</a> Junior Champions for three years from 2016–2018. In 2018, he was appointed First Head of Whole <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a> Youth Academy.
